titleStmt.title: Slovenski parlamentarni korpus ParlaMint-SI-en, 30. izredna seja (28. 11. 2007) [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Slovenian parliamentary corpus ParlaMint-SI-en, Extraordinary Session 30, November 28, 2007 [ParlaMint-en.ana SAMPLE]
Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije, Izredna 4. mandat, 30. izredna seja (28. 11. 2007)
Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia, Term 4, Extraordinary Session 30, (28. 11. 2007)

respStmt.resp: Machine translation to English and linguistic analysis of the translation
Annotating MTed corpora with USAS semantic tags

funder.orgName: Raziskovalni program ARRS P6-0411 "Jezikovni viri in tehnologije za slovenski jezik"
Slovenian Research Agency Programme P6-0411 "Language Resources and Technologies for Slovene"

availability.p: This work is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
To delo je ponujeno pod Creative Commons Priznanje avtorstva 4.0 mednarodna licenca.

bibl.title: Minutes of the National Assembly of the Republic of Slovenia
Zapisi sej Državnega zbora Republike Slovenije

projectDesc.p: ParlaMint is a project that aims to (1) create a multilingual set of comparable corpora of parliamentary proceedings uniformly encoded according to the ParlaMint encoding guidelines, covering the period from 2015 to mid-2022; (2) add linguistic annotations to the corpora and machine-translate them to English; (3) make the corpora available through concordancers; and (4) build use cases in Political Sciences and Digital Humanities based on the corpus data.

prefixDef.p: Private URIs with this prefix point to aligned source elements of the MTed corpus.

revisionDesc.change: Tomaž Erjavec: Generate TEI version of MTed corpus.
Tomaž Erjavec: Small fixes of ParlaMint data

div.head: DRŽAVNI ZBOR REPUBLIKE SLOVENIJE
Nadaljevanje 30. izredne seje
Sejo je vodil Sašo Peče, podpredsednik Državnega zbora.
div.note: The Vice-President of the Commission shall:
THE PRESIDENT OF FRANCE CAN DO THIS:
The meeting was closed on 28 November 2007 at 23.24 p.m.
